overview:
## Return Value

The `NSBundle` object with the bundle identifier `identifier`, or `nil` if the requested bundle is not found on the system. This method creates and returns a new `NSBundle` object if there is no existing bundle associated with `identifier`. Otherwise, the existing instance is returned.

## Discussion

This method is typically used by frameworks and plug-ins to locate their own bundle at runtime. This method may be somewhat more efficient than trying to locate the bundle using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Bundle/init(for:)] method. However, if the initial lookup of an already loaded and cached bundle with the specified identifier fails, this method uses potentially time-consuming heuristics to attempt to locate the bundle. As an optimization, you can use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSBundle/bundleWithPath:] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSBundle/bundleWithURL:] method instead to avoid file system traversal.

# init(identifier:)

**Initializer**

Returns the `NSBundle` instance that has the specified bundle identifier.

## Declaration

```swift
init?(identifier: String)
```

## Parameters

- **identifier**: The identifier for an existing `NSBundle` instance.

## Return Value

The `NSBundle` object with the bundle identifier `identifier`, or `nil` if the requested bundle is not found on the system. This method creates and returns a new `NSBundle` object if there is no existing bundle associated with `identifier`. Otherwise, the existing instance is returned.

## Discussion

This method is typically used by frameworks and plug-ins to locate their own bundle at runtime. This method may be somewhat more efficient than trying to locate the bundle using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Bundle/init(for:)] method. However, if the initial lookup of an already loaded and cached bundle with the specified identifier fails, this method uses potentially time-consuming heuristics to attempt to locate the bundle. As an optimization, you can use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSBundle/bundleWithPath:] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSBundle/bundleWithURL:] method instead to avoid file system traversal.

## Creating and Initializing a Bundle

- **init(for:)**: Returns the `NSBundle` object with which the specified class is associated.
- **init(url:)**: Returns an `NSBundle` object initialized to correspond to the specified file URL.
- **init(path:)**: Returns an `NSBundle` object initialized to correspond to the specified directory.
